content: Hello Mister Schmidt, my name is Farhad Abbasi from Iran. Thanks for inviting me to see the apartment in Duisburg. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Farhad Abbasi from Iran

content: Hello Farhad, it's my pleasure to meet you. I'm glad you like the apartment. As a landlord, I'm always looking to get the best possible price for my properties. So, let's get down to business. What do you think would be a fair price for this apartment? Keep in mind, it's a newly built, unfurnished 50 square meter one-bedroom apartment in the city center, close to all important facilities.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I understand that, Mister Schmidt. Considering the condition of the apartment and its location, I think a price of 500 euros per month would be appropriate.
name: Farhad Abbasi from Iran

content:
Ah, 500 euros per month, that's an interesting starting point, Farhad. I must say, I was thinking more along the lines of 700 euros per month. After all, the apartment is brand new and located in the heart of the city. But I'm always open to negotiation.

Tell me, Farhad, what do you think would be a fair price for the apartment, considering its location and condition?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Taking into account the condition of the apartment and its location, I propose a price of 600 euros per month.
name: Farhad Abbasi from Iran

content:
Hmm, 600 euros per month. That's a bit closer to what I had in mind, Farhad. But I'm afraid that's still a bit too low. You see, the apartment is not only new and well-maintained, but it's also in a prime location, with all the amenities and transportation links you could need right at your doorstep.

I think a more appropriate price would be around 750 euros per month. That way, we can both benefit from this arrangement. What do you think?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I understand your point, Mister Schmidt. Considering the condition of the apartment and its location, I propose a price of 650 euros per month.
name: Farhad Abbasi from Iran

content:
Ah, 650 euros per month. That's a more reasonable offer, Farhad. I must say, I was expecting a bit more, but I'm willing to make a compromise. After all, I want to make sure that the apartment is rented out to a reliable tenant like yourself.

Tell me, Farhad, are you willing to commit to a one-year lease at this price? And do you have any references or a security deposit ready to secure the apartment?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I am willing to commit to a one-year lease at this price. I have a reliable reference from my previous landlord and I am also ready to provide a security deposit.
name: Farhad Abbasi from Iran

content:
Excellent, Farhad! I'm glad to hear that you're willing to commit to a one-year lease and that you have a reliable reference from your previous landlord. That gives me a lot of confidence in your ability to be a responsible tenant.

Now, let's talk about the security deposit. I typically require a security deposit of one month's rent, which in this case would be 750 euros. This deposit will be refundable at the end of the lease, provided that the apartment is returned in good condition and there are no outstanding rent payments.

I also want to mention that I have a strict no-smoking policy in all of my rental properties. Smoking is not allowed anywhere in the apartment, including on the balcony. I understand that this may be a bit restrictive, but I have to think about the health and well-being of all my tenants.

Assuming everything checks out, I'm willing to rent the apartment to you for 650 euros per month, with a one-year lease and a security deposit of 750 euros. What do you think? Is that something you'd be interested in?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I agree to the price of [650] euros!
name: Farhad Abbasi from Iran

content:
Great, Farhad! I'm glad we could come to an agreement on the price. Just one more thing to take care of before we can finalize the rental agreement.

As a responsible landlord, I need to make sure that my tenants have adequate insurance coverage. I require all my tenants to have a minimum of 50,000 euros in personal liability insurance. This will protect both you and me in case of any accidents or damages to the property.

Do you already have insurance coverage that meets this requirement? If not, don't worry, I can provide you with some affordable options.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany
